item.description:
****SEE MAP IN FILES AREA OF THIS SITE****

This month we meet at the home of Tom & Lee in Gorham. The full agenda is TBD but it will be focused on green building with a chance to see one of the few LEED certified homes in the state of Maine (there will be slides/photos as part of the discussion of this house!)

If we don't do a specific narrow green building topic (check back in a couple of weeks) then we may do a green building roundup of what's going on across the state so people can "plug in" in whatever way appeals to them. If you know of stuff going on with residential alt energy, straw bale, cob, earth berm, net zero, "mainstream" green bldg, etc. - please email me and let me know!!!

[A week earlier than normal to accomodate a special meetup on 11/14 and not have too many events in one week! Sorry to conflict with voting day, but...]

Arrive between 6 and 6:30
6:30 potluck supper
7:15 discussion w/photos.../tour/etc starts

*NEW* Don't forget to bring your own potluck kit of plate/bowl/cup/utensils/cloth napkin - we're trying to move away from disposable or even compostable stuff starting this month!

Potluck breakdown:
Last name starting with A-G bring whatever you want
Last name starting with H-M bring bread or beverage
Last name starting with N-S main or side dish to share
Last name starting with T-Z bring salad or veg or dessert

DIRECTIONS NOTE: This is a fairly new street so refer to the map in the FILES area of this site if needed.

CARPOOL: Meet at Marginal Way Park-and-Ride at 5:45 to depart no later than 6:00 to head to Gorham. If you want to carpool, start a thread on the message board and don't forget your phone or cell phone number if applicable.

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: November Meetup: Residential Green Building
